attack_chains.impact: SQL injection can lead to complete database compromise and data exfiltration
attack_chains.proof_of_concept:
Attack Chain: Sqli To Data Breach
Severity: CRITICAL

Impact: SQL injection can lead to complete database compromise and data exfiltration

Exploitation Steps:
1. Inject malicious SQL queries
   └─ Found at: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query
   └─ SQL Injection Proof of Concept:

Endpoint: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query
Method: 
2. Extract database structure
3. Dump sensitive data including credentials

Remediation:
- Fix all underlying vulnerabilities
- Implement defense in depth
- Add security monitoring and alerting

vulnerabilities.description: The parameter 'searchFor' is vulnerable to Boolean-based (with comment) SQL injection. Response length changed by 2523 bytes. This allows attackers to manipulate database queries and potentially extract, modify, or delete data.
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
SQL Injection Proof of Concept:

Endpoint: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query
Method: POST
Parameter: searchFor
Payload: ' OR '1'='1' --

Detection: Response length changed by 2523 bytes

Reproduction Steps:
1. Navigate to: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query
2. Submit form with:
   searchFor=' OR '1'='1' --
3. Observe SQL error or behavior change

Impact:
- Database enumeration
- Data extraction (passwords, credit cards, PII)
- Data modification or deletion
- Authentication bypass
- Remote code execution (in some cases)
vulnerabilities.raw_data: {"parameter": "searchFor", "payload": "' OR '1'='1' --", "technique": "Boolean-based (with comment)", "detection": "Response length changed by 2523 bytes", "method": "POST", "evidence_id": 11}
vulnerabilities.remediation:
Use parameterized queries (prepared statements) exclusively.
Never concatenate user input into SQL queries.
Use stored procedures with parameterized inputs.
Implement proper input validation and sanitization.
Apply principle of least privilege to database accounts.
Use ORM frameworks that handle parameterization.
Implement web application firewall (WAF) rules.
vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection in searchFor (Boolean-based (with comment))

vulnerabilities.description: The parameter 'searchFor' is vulnerable to HTML-based XSS. User input is reflected in the HTML context without proper encoding, allowing execution of malicious JavaScript code.
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
XSS Proof of Concept:

Endpoint: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query
Method: POST
Parameter: searchFor
Payload: <script>alert(1)</script>

Reproduction Steps:
1. Navigate to: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query
2. Submit form with:
   searchFor=<script>alert(1)</script>
3. Observe JavaScript execution (alert box appears)

Impact:
- Session hijacking via cookie theft
- Phishing attacks
- Keylogging
- Page defacement
- Malware distribution
vulnerabilities.remediation:
Use HTML entity encoding for all user input in HTML context. Encode <, >, &, ", ' characters.

Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) headers.
Use HTTPOnly and Secure flags on cookies.
Validate and sanitize all input server-side.
vulnerabilities.title: XSS in searchFor (HTML Context)

Starting Nmap 7.95 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2025-10-25 10:50 EDT
Nmap scan report for testphp.vulnweb.com (44.228.249.3)
Host is up (0.085s latency).
rDNS record for 44.228.249.3: ec2-44-228-249-3.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com
Not shown: 998 filtered tcp ports (no-response)
Some closed ports may be reported as filtered due to --defeat-rst-ratelimit
PORT   STATE SERVICE    VERSION
53/tcp open  tcpwrapped
80/tcp open  http       nginx 1.19.0

Service detection performed. Please report any incorre
vulnerabilities.remediation: Close unnecessary ports or restrict access via firewall
